dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: People think hailstorms are just a summer nuisance, but actually they can be massive and destructive, like the quail-egg-sized hail that just hit northern Kazakhstan.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: People think hailstorms are just a summer nuisance, but actually they can be massive and destructive, like the quail-egg-sized hail that just hit northern Kazakhstan.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Residents of northern Kazakhstan have shared photos and videos of unusually large hailstones, reportedly the size of quail eggs.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and it was on April 28th, right? The forecasters totally warned about thunderstorms and wind gusts up to 30 meters per second.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and it was on April twenty eighth, right? The forecasters totally warned about thunderstorms and wind gusts up to thirty meters per second.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: On April 28, the North Kazakhstan region was expected to see thunderstorms, rain with possible large hail, fog, and wind gusts reaching up to 30¯m/s.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. And despite all that hail and rain, can you believe temperatures in Petropavlovsk were still pretty warm, like 19 to 24 degrees?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. And despite all that hail and rain, can you believe temperatures in Petropavlovsk were still pretty warm, like nineteen to twenty four degrees?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Despite the precipitation, temperatures in Petropavlovsk remained warm on April 28, ranging from 19¯ÂC to 24¯ÂC across the region.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Oh wow, so it was warm enough for a t-shirt but hailing hard enough to break windows. That's wild.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh wow, so it was warm enough for a t-shirt but hailing hard enough to break windows. That's wild.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: But then they're saying it's gonna drop sharply—like, by April 29th, rain mixed with snow and gusts up to 30 m/s again.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But then they're saying it's gonna drop sharply-like, by April twenty ninth, rain mixed with snow and gusts up to thirty meters per second again.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: "Rain mixed with snow is expected in the west, north, and east of the North Kazakhstan region. Wind speeds are forecast at 15"20¯m/s, with gusts up to 28"30¯m/s and possibly higher," the statement said.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And then overnight into the 30th, they're expecting frost. Like, below freezing, zero to minus three Celsius.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And then overnight into the thirtieth, they're expecting frost. Like, below freezing, zero to minus three Celsius.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: On the night of April 30, temperatures could dip below freezing, with frost expected to range from 0¯ÂC to -3¯ÂC, forecasters added.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: So in just a couple days, you go from almost summer weather to possible frost. That's a huge swing.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So in just a couple days, you go from almost summer weather to possible frost. That's a huge swing.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: It really is. I mean, imagine waking up to hailstones the size of small eggs one day and worrying about frost the next.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It really is. I mean, imagine waking up to hailstones the size of small eggs one day and worrying about frost the next.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Residents of northern Kazakhstan have shared photos and videos of unusually large hailstones, reportedly the size of quail eggs.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And the social media footage showed the ground just blanketed in ice. Must've been surreal for residents.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And the social media footage showed the ground just blanketed in ice. Must've been surreal for residents.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Footage posted on social media shows sizable hail covering the ground across parts of the region.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: For sure. And with fog expected overnight too, driving conditions are gonna be rough on top of everything.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure. And with fog expected overnight too, driving conditions are gonna be rough on top of everything.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Fog is likely during the night and morning hours in these areas.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, that wind speed warning—15 to 20 m/s consistently—is no joke either. That's strong enough to knock down branches, maybe even power lines.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, that wind speed warningminus fifteen to twenty meters per second consistently-is no joke either. That's strong enough to knock down branches, maybe even power lines.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Wind speeds are forecast at 15"20¯m/s, with gusts up to 28"30¯m/s and possibly higher," the statement said.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Definitely a reminder how quickly weather can turn, especially in regions like northern Kazakhstan.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Definitely a reminder how quickly weather can turn, especially in regions like northern Kazakhstan.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. Goes to show you can't take a warm afternoon for granted this time of year.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. Goes to show you can't take a warm afternoon for granted this time of year.
